name: Git Ignore File
summary: A GITIGNORE file is a settings file used by Git, a version control system that allows developers to track source code changes. It contains a list of files that should not be included in the source code repository . GITIGNORE files help developers exclude unwanted items such as hidden operating system files (e.g., .DS_Store and Thumbs.db ), temporary files, and project outputs.
